Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pup \Pup\, n. [See {Puppy}.] (Zo["o]l.) (a) A young dog; a puppy. (b) a young seal. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pup \Pup\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Pupped}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Pupping}.] To bring forth whelps or young, as the female of the canine species. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)
Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: pup n 1: young of any of various canines such as a dog or wolf [syn: {whelp}] 2: an inexperienced young person [syn: {puppy}] v : birth; "the dog whelped" [syn: {whelp}] [also: {pupping}, {pupped}]
